data.text:
School Profile

The University Eugenio Maria de Hostos, Uniremhos, is an educational institution stimulating thinking, creative and scientific discussion. It is an intellectual space for the development of scientific culture through the professionalization of people in different areas of knowledge and technical-professional training. The formation of the human being is assumed as a requirement and imperative of today's citizen who demands to join the development of society in its multiple expressions and the contingencies of each historical moment.

Education responds to the needs of the present as a way of contributing to the construction of the future. In the particular framework of this University, this training takes place immersed in a climate of Christian humanism as a basis for unquestionable respect for human dignity. It is committed to the task of encouraging human beings to recreate society and guide its development in ways that enable the emergence of new conditions, increasingly more appropriate to that dignity. We assume a university education that transforms reality and generates spiritual and material wealth, since its objective is not only to prepare professionals who adapt to existing conditions, but to transform it agents.

The subjects of this education are called to be protesters, critics and creators of values, knowledge, technology and science. In our university we also assume that the center of the educational process is the student, since their needs, interests and motivations are taken into account so that they are the axis of the educational project, the protagonist of any learning process and the promoter of their own development. and personal growth. Both aspects, on the one hand, being prepared, transformative and critical professionals and, on the other, being the leading center of their own training, all without an iota of impairment of their human dignity as is typical of Christian values, is the fundamental objective of education at UNIREMHOS.

The center of the educational process is the student, since his needs, interests and motivations are taken into account so that he is the axis of the educational project, the protagonist of any learning process and the promoter of his own development and personal growth. Mission Contribute to the development and sociocultural strengthening and the production and dissemination of universal knowledge, through the training of human resources, in accordance with national and global standards, and the search for efficient scientific and technological answers, deeply humanistic and bases of the social development. Vision To be an institution of higher education that offers its students spaces for teaching-learning and research and innovation destined to the cultivation of a comprehensive professional training and social commitment, to the intellectual production of high standards and training for successful insertion in fields competitive and globalized.

Values

1. Humanistic attitude motivated by the defense of universal and Christian values, and of our native culture.

2. Solidarity with the entire university family, especially the professional training of people with limited resources, and with the community in general.

3. Mystique of service of all our staff, and of teachers and students in the execution of social projects of connection with the environment.

4. Integrity of the professionals of our institution for their ethical and Christian qualities, their technical capabilities and their commitment to society.

5. Critical and constructive attitude towards the ideas and behaviors that make up our social and economic reality.

6. Visionary attitude with innovative and sustainable creativity, vision of the future and entrepreneurial character.

Message from Rector

The Eugenio María de Hostos University is an ally of personal improvement and, consequently, of the development and future of society. Through the training of qualified human resources, we contribute to design, assemble and put into operation the appropriate platform to establish justice, equity and the creation of opportunities for all. In this university, knowledge is cultivated, because we stimulate in all members of the educational community the passion for meaningful learning in its highest ranks, as well as the desire to achieve ever higher goals; in such a way that they make our graduated human beings more noble, more rational and more socially committed.

The Dominican Republic is a Caribbean country that occupies the eastern two-thirds of the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. The western one-third of Hispaniola is occupied by the country of Haiti. To the north lies the North Atlantic Ocean, while the Caribbean Sea lies to the south.

Know More

As part of the Caribbean the Dominican Republic has the North Atlantic Ocean lying to its north and the Caribbean Sea to its south. It's situated on the island of Hispaniola and occupies the eastern two-thirds of the island while Haiti occupies the western third.

After attaining independence in 1844 the Dominican Republic endured many years of a largely non-representative rule until Joaquin Balaguer became president in 1966 holding office until 1996. Today regular elections are held and the Dominican Republic now has an impressive and fast growing economy with tourism playing a major role.

For the adventure tourist this Caribbean country offers a diverse countryside comprising tropical rainforests, arid desert expanses, alpine ranges and steamy mangrove swamps. It's a playground for trekkers, mountain bike enthusiasts and water-sport junkies.

The northern and eastern coasts are dotted with many luxurious resorts however the Dominican Republic has much more to offer than this. There is the wonderful Caribbean music and dance, exotic foods and drink, popular local baseball games, and the remarkable colonial architecture found in the capital Santo Domingo’s Zona Colonial. There are also sugar plantations, small quaint villages and wonderful mountain retreats to explore and enjoy in Jarabacoa and Constanza. If you're looking for a hassle free holiday that's big on relaxation then the Dominican Republic is the place to be!

Climate

Tropical maritime with little seasonal temperature variation. There is a seasonal variation in rainfall. The island lies in the middle of the hurricane belt and is subject to severe storms from June to October. It experiences occasional flooding and periodic droughts.
